website_summaries.verdict: A good PC cube case for anyone looking to build a custom PC for gaming or work.
pros: Large interior space offers more modularity than traditional computer cases
Sides open up to offer convenient access to the interior for replacing parts
cons: Can be difficult to mount motherboard with the included fasteners and hardware

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is great as well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased X9 White for my first custom cooling loop build. After completing the build with two loops (first for CPU, second for 2 GPUs) I'm sure I would have a lot more trouble with a smaller case. I think this case is ideal for custom loops, especially for novice. The build quality is great as well, just like other cases from Thermaltake. Pictures of my almost completed build attached.
customer_reviews.author: V. Fridman

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cube case out there
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cube-type case after being a mid-tower user for years. The biggest advantage for me of cube cases is having a flat motherboard plane so that you don't have to worry about GPU sag. The EATX compatibility is also a huge plus, and its really roomy to build in. My biggest downsides of this case are: 1. The lack of USB-C ports 2. The location of the existing USB ports -- rather than having 4 on one side, it would have been nice to have 2 on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh Littles

customer_reviews.title: The only case that will mount e-atx motherboard horizontally with 3x 5.25 bay
customer_reviews.text: I use a 2x5.25 water resivare with a temperature readout, water level, and flow indicator. + 1 blue-ray burner. This case is discontinued and vary hard to get ... took me 6 tries. Vary flexible modular design with a lot of parts. Side panes swap, p/s can go on either side, the controles swap sides. Stackable, I put mine on a small moving dolly. Big and wide, easier to find in white. Filters are magnetic, if you use the top 5.25 bay you can't instal the forth fan on 480 mm rads... no big deal. Cable management is vary easy, I replaced the 120 mm fan with 2 x 140mm on the back, 200mm on the front is good.
customer_reviews.author: FAAAST EDDIE

customer_reviews.title: Lot of space
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Threadripper build with a AIO water cooling solution. Plenty of space for HDDs below motherboard tray. Plenty of space above motherboard for cooling tubes and long enough for large video cards. Lots of room to mount radiator. Not the most glamourous, but I purchased it for purely functional reasons. Fairly flexible in USB panel placement. Sturdy construction. Screws for add in cards don't fit as well as those from other cases I own. They strip out pretty easily. Plastic parts can easily break if not careful, but the overall 5.25" and 3.5" rail system for drives works.
customer_reviews.author: ElleWishes

customer_reviews.title: Good if you value sheer amount of customization, otherwise there are better choices
customer_reviews.text: This is a good case if you want to do some dual system in once case or some elobarate water cooling setup, but it wasn't for me. I had three issues with this case: 1. Stock 200mm front fan is lound, lower than the rear 120mm fan, how does that happen? 2. The usb 3.0 connectors are poorly made, mine arrived without the stub resulting in loose contact 3. Absolutly no cable management assistance, you need to do this on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Mnoi

customer_reviews.title: Neat, even when missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product even though it showed up missing one of the side fan mounts that mounts two fans. Or that it had no manual. Or that some of the screw mounts were not fully tapped. BUT! It is an awesome case. I just wish the thermal take site had the ability to order accessories like a screw pack or extra side mounts for the case. Especially side fan mounts for the case. Side note, as a reminder, the front panel has 4x USB 3.0. That is 2x 3.0 USB motherboard headers.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: It's really cool, and really HUGE
customer_reviews.text: I chose this case for my latest PC build, as I wanted something with tons of cabling and cooling options...and I have the space in my office, so, what the heck. Yes, this thing is massively huge - Massive with a capital M. It is well built, offers a ton of configuration options and I found it super easy to use in my build. I love the look and would purchase it again. I have no cons to offer on this one. The price was a value for what you receive - that was icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G

customer_reviews.title: A beast
customer_reviews.text: It's huge....a large amount of space...both inside and required to support it on your desk or floor. I found the quality to be fine, although the removable hard drive trays are a bit flimsy...and the clips used to hold the drives in are even moreso... Did I say this thing is large? 2 PSU spots...3 5.25" bays...7+ Hard drive areas...big area for cable management. extra fans..radiators... If you're looking for space to grow, space to water cool....space for airflow.. This thing gives it to you....would I buy it again knowing it now? Probably not, just because it BARELY fits on my desk...It's a fine case otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Baddog

customer_reviews.title: HUGE Case
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge case, you need a lot of space for it so buyer beware. That being said, I love it for my custom dual Xeon workstation. I have two 240mm Noctua fans mounted in the top of the case, two 120mm Noctua fans in the back, one 120mm fan in the front, and two big three-fan AIO water blocks for my CPUs on the side. This thing has fan mounts to move a ton of air and it's so cavernous inside that cable management is a breeze. It's not a very attractive case but it sits in my basement under my desk I so I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Huge and nothing but the very Best
customer_reviews.text: This case is incredibly huge, and it is exactly what I was looking for. it is really well made, pretty much everything is metal but the hard drive cases, which need to be plastic in order for you to remove them fast. I wanted a case that would allow me easy installation and future proof extreme expandability, and man this one delivers. I'm using and extended motherboard with 7pci slots and 12 sata ports, which will allow me eventually to have 4 GPU water cooled and an 8 Hard drive Raid, which was what I was going for and this case has room for all of that.
customer_reviews.author: CDK

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The images might make it look beefy and sturdy, but it's only thinly stamped steel with a black coating. I'm not sure if it's powder coated or painted, but it can be scratched very easily. Many of the motherboard stand-offs were difficult to remove and the threads were easily stripped out. The stand-offs were also the smaller size screw-type. It's big. It's cheap. It's great if you want to stuff a lot of radiators into, but it's not the best put-together case. It's just okay.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case
customer_reviews.text: I have built many custom computers and this is by far my favorite case. Fast shipping and great packaging; despite this, the door arrived slightly bent. Amazon was able to rectify the situation. Things to keep in mind. This case is HUGE. It is much bigger than it appears in pictures. It is fully modular and made out of high quality material. Was a breeze to install components. The only con is the hard drive bays. Depending on how you set up the case they will only mount on one side. They do have an additional tray that goes above the psu that can hold 2 ssds or 1 mechanical drive. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SlowMN

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. It's Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case!!! There is nothing bad to say about it. I have 10 fans on it including 2 for my liquid cooled CPU. I run intakes from the lower back the lower side and center front. I have fans pulling out the upper back and top. This keeps fresh air circulating in a sideways "U" pattern.I spoke with some guys at Thermaltake that had not thought of this pattern, but said it sounds good. For your rear intakes get a Thermaltake Magnetic Fan Filter. They work great. My system stays super cool. My system is high-end and I run a lot of drives. I do photographs and video editing.
customer_reviews.author: Omnicool

customer_reviews.title: Its a monster
customer_reviews.text: After months of having it, it is a great case. Much bigger than the picture shows. Make sure you have the dimensions and a spot before you order. Plenty of room for everything. Thermaltakes website is the place to go to find out what this case can do and how it can be configured.
customer_reviews.author: spicytwinkie

customer_reviews.title: Impressive case for the price... If you have the room.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy panels, spacious, very well ventilated with ample options for Cooling Fans or AIO placement including a bottom grill with dust tray, highly customizable chassis, you can swap left and right panels and swappable left and right front USB ports and power panels to have them on either side. Easy thumb screw components, that are a breeze to remove or relocate, very sturdy MB tray with great wire management cut-outs. Incredible case for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This case is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't fully realize the size of this thing when I ordered it and I was actually going to return it because of how big it is. In the end I decided to keep it and I am so glad I did. This case is the best PC case I have ever used. Tool-less everything and room for pretty much anything you could want to put in it.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: With this much open space in your case it doesn't take much air to keep it cool, and less airflow mean father intervals between
customer_reviews.text: This thing is UGLY! But it's huge! Most every part of this case is interchangeable so it can fit how you want. Plenty of ports for plumbing and very well vented. With this much open space in your case it doesn't take much air to keep it cool, and less airflow mean father intervals between cleaning. Also I was very impressed with how well it was built, very solid and the panels remove and replace with ease. So if you want a case for utility and ease of maintenance and don't care if your case is stupidly huge, this is perfect for you :)
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Case of the Gods!
customer_reviews.text: I cracked up with some of the other reviews and went ahead and bought this thing. My family let me know that I got a box and they thought I bought a massive Microvave or a Beer fridge or an Oven. Options forever. I will grow old and die with this case. There really are no pictures that show off how massive this thing really is and how much fun it is to build in this thing. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: zettabyte

customer_reviews.title: Large but not sturdy. Good design concept with poor quality of implementation.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Spacious, logically organized design. Visually pleasing. Could park a small car in it if you don't use it as a computer case. Cons: Under-built for its size and weight. Small fasteners and needs more reinforcement for its size... Large but not sturdy. This is not a case you will want to nor will you enjoy moving many times. It will flex and small fasteners do not hold the large heavy panels in place well.
customer_reviews.author: The Reluctant Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It would be awesome if
customer_reviews.text: It would be awesome if they would take the time to make sure they package the door with the plastic better because mine came cracked as i knew it would. I also had to bend the metal on one door because it was dropped in shipping. Other than that it really nice. Its bigger than I was thinking and figuring out how to get this on my shelf is gonna be fun.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate ITX build.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room for a two radiator, gpu/cpu, 300ml watercooler. Setup allow for ultimate cooling and performance for an ITX builds. Size of case more like a Midtower size case. If you want to go crazy, you can stack two of them. The build quality needs improvement as any plastic parts are susceptible to breaking. Lots of ventilation meaning you need to run fans less than 1200 rpms because more noise leak out of case. Thermaltake USA does to an excellent job getting you the replacement parts if needed and respond promptly.
customer_reviews.author: The Golfer 02

customer_reviews.title: If you've got the space, get this case!
customer_reviews.text: This computer case is huge! You could probably put two computers in this thing. If you want to have plenty of space for working inside the computer, and for a custom water cooled setup, this case is for you. There are plenty of mounts for fans and radiators, and the fans it comes with are virtually silent. The extensive use of thumb screws makes disassembly and installing/modifying the configuration rather easy.
customer_reviews.author: RichardZ

customer_reviews.title: The only gripe i see is if you've got a fancy mobo like say the msi x99a godlike
customer_reviews.text: The chassis is huge, not overly huge but it is rather big. The water cooling possibilities are almost limitless. It's everything i ever needed in a case as far as room to work in. I haven't done anything crazy with my liquid build but i do find it special. The only gripe i see is if you've got a fancy mobo like say the msi x99a godlike, showing it off is almost nonexistent because you would then have to mod your top cover to a fiber/plexiglass. Which also means no radiators up top. Also i wish there was an option from tt to purchase a glassed side.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Rain

customer_reviews.title: Great case well though out
customer_reviews.text: Great case well though out. Some flaws in the design but if you can fabricate and make things the way you want them then don't worry about it. So much room!!! A little concerned about a bunch of scratches and a few dings on exterior of case. They were there before this case was packaged. Need some new employees!!
customer_reviews.author: Woody S.

customer_reviews.title: Houses my #3 in the world SETI cruncher
customer_reviews.text: Best possible case for quad hydro gpu installations. Large and deep. Plenty of space for everything and endless configuration possibilities. #3 in the world for SETI production currently.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Myers

customer_reviews.title: super super huge!
customer_reviews.text: Its super super huge! I got enough room to get my black&red setup and enough room to add action figures inside. :) I got a 7 year old motherboard in it right now, but I plan on having Z170A Gaming M7 motherboard with black&red led fans. Also its big enough to put an imperial star destroyer toy on it and the action figure I plan on getting is Kylo Ren with light up lightsaber. Heh.. Sorry. Case is super good :)
customer_reviews.author: Chris t

customer_reviews.title: Good case, questionable quality control
customer_reviews.text: The case is impressive, but the quality control is bad. Some thumb screws were bent and the front audio cable was damaged beyond use. While I love the features and design, receiving parts damaged makes me hesitant to purchase from the manufacturer again
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Case is HUGE
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest case I have ever seen. Yes, it has tons of options and you can hang about 100 fans in it but make sure you know the dimensions and have a place for it. I put it in my basement because under the desk wasn't an option. Good construction but gave it 4 stars because there is no reason any case for a single pc needs to be this big. Way too much open/wasted space. Its almost as big as a 12u server rack!!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great case but cheap case feet. Came broken.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the case. Lots of space and features to improve ease of use. However the feet are made of cheap plastic so when my case came in, 3 of the 4 case feet were broken. Not sure if there's a way to ask Amazon for small replacement parts and I don't want to have to ship the entire case back to Amazon so I'm currently waiting on Thermaltake support.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Best case I have owned. The construction quality is on par with premium cases in this price range. What I like most about this case is the size. It has plenty of room and most pieces are easily removable with thumb screws. Working inside this case is much easier than any case I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Captain cold! Keeping it cool.
customer_reviews.text: This is the mother of all cases! I bought this to be my home server! It holds my 3 3.5” drives perfectly and my one 2.5 SSD. I have a micro ATX board with a Corsair dual fan all in one water cooling. I mounted the radiator to the top to suck in cool air. I also mounted fans inside the case on the bottom! Yeap there are brackets there too! It is a monster at keeping the machine cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Dao

customer_reviews.title: Forget your microbox, get this mega one.
customer_reviews.text: Caveat emptor! This is a monster of a box, so absolutely make certain you have enough space for it. But in the couple of months of owning it, it has been amazing. Everything installed beautifully and easily and there's loads of room to work on the innards. There's also loads of room for fans.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Dragon

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I wanted and more. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted and more. I needed something with long-term flexibility and expand-ability, this works perfectly. It is a large, stack-able, case. I can see myself using this case for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Josh aka Patch

customer_reviews.title: Great case but needs more quality assurance...
customer_reviews.text: This would have received all 5 stars were it not for the warped front panel which caused the fan filter to rub against the front fan and make awful slicking noises. I had to remove the front filter in order to regain my sanity. Aside from that it's hard to argue with a case this versatile and MASSIVE for the price. It's a beast!
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have room.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute unit. It is big, crazy big, but lots of room for all of my stuff. It takes the weight of the video card off the motherboard by rotating the motherboard tray. Lots of room for cooling and expansion. I am running a home media server (plex) with mine, so that is using 5 of the hard drive bays, while my system and other programs run off my M2 SSD. There are options to add extra cages and fan supports from the manufacturer if you need further expansion.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beattie

customer_reviews.title: quality is good and design flexibility for the super builder is great ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG this thing is HUGE! those dimensions on the box are right and this thing will not fit on top of or underneath any normal desk it needs its own room, quality is good and design flexibility for the super builder is great though, you can stuff 4 quad coolers, and 3 triple coolers in it if you want or some where around 18 fans if you went that route.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Poor material usage
customer_reviews.text: Plastic components are very brittle. Two of the feet broke before I got them off. 5.25 drive holders broke with very little tension as I tried to put them on. Thankfully I have a 3D printer and can replace them with quality plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Siedlyk

customer_reviews.title: Massive!
customer_reviews.text: Massive case. Was able to fit 2 480 mm thick rads in push config. With a evga x99 board and new 2080, a 2 pump res and 6 ssd/HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Carazo

customer_reviews.title: BEST CASE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS CASE! going to be building my first water cooled case. going to stack one on the other and have cooliong loops for both the Video cards and the CPU. More than enough room. You can also order a extra side window so you can see tough the case. has to send one back to to shipping damage but that's not the fault of the seller. One thing to keep in mind..this is a VERY big case. make sure you have the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice case
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty nice case. The internal space is great for adding and building your own parts. I knocked a star off because the hard drive cages could be a little sturdier; however, after I built some brackets to sturdy up the hard drive cages I was able to add a 140 mm fan to each cage so the hard drives will run cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R

customer_reviews.title: Item was used and sold as new
customer_reviews.text: The window was scratched in multiple places, making the viewing panel unusable. This was to show off the LED lighting and water cooled system. All the parts were either in a sandwich ziplock bag or rattling around in the case. This case looks like someone used it for a while and then packaged it up to resell. I do not have time to return it, as this build is for a customer and is needed this week. I will have to take the panel off one of my other towers and place it on this "new" X9 before passing it on to the customer.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE TIME OR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: As soon as we took this out of the box 3 out of 4 feet snapped off immediately what kind of quality is that!? Then as my boyfriend tries to build his computer a piece of metal in the hdd bay was bent as if someone else tried using it once I bought this brand new... so many issues and I played double from what its listed as now so pissed I'd rate it a 0 if i could.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very customizable, but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool design for a case but it's very cheaply made. Mine came out of the box with one of the feet broken off, and a second one broke by simply rotating the case on my desk. The materials are very flimsy. That said, it is very customizable. Most of the internals can be adjusted to fit the needs of the components.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Received item within 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Received item within 24 hours! This case is huge! Item was well packaged. Very sturdy construction. Plenty of room for a ton of cooling equipment and hard drives galore. I was able to mount my AquaComputer 360mm radiator with D5 pump/res combo without any problems. Nothing a good hacksaw and a little patience can't fix. Knew I would have to make a slight "adjustment" before I purchased it to get the reservoir to fit out the top of the radiator mount.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: This case is the perfect solution for my needs....
customer_reviews.text: This case is the perfect solution for my needs. I have 2 ASUS Ares II 7970x2 GPU cards and a water-cooled AMD 9590 CPU that were begging for a bigger case and this one if a perfect home for that system.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, and ginormous
customer_reviews.text: The layout, cable management, and modular nature of this case are wonderful. It's built really sturdy. If I were doing a lot more customization it would be a great platform for it. Only one thing...this case is HUGEMONGOUS! Take a look at the specs before you order it. I still love it and it fortunately fits on my rather large desk. Great case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellington

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Feels somewhat low quality and some screws are tapped crooked, but overall happy
customer_reviews.author: Luke Thighwalker

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, but a lot of space from fans to board.
customer_reviews.text: Spacious, attractive, but need powerful static fans due to the large body of room between your board and the fan mounts. I had to carefully plan how i set up my airflow to keep my behemoth cool.
customer_reviews.author: Blaze74118

customer_reviews.title: big case
customer_reviews.text: If you want a case with a lot of room this is the case it's big and has a lot of room for graphic cards coolers even the 4 fans one's also a lot of hard drive space and even SSD cards and the case can be stacked for extreme cooling as seen on TT web site.
customer_reviews.author: greydog

customer_reviews.title: Great case! Lots of space in the middle
customer_reviews.text: Great case! Lots of space in the middle. Very easy to do custom liquid cooling due to the free area of space inside it.
customer_reviews.author: Maximilianair L.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best PC case for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this case for about a year, and am very satisfied. If you don't like small cases, just need some space for your parts, then this is the case you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Byung Choi

customer_reviews.title: but everything with this case is amazing, and the design is excellent
customer_reviews.text: There's no way around this. This case is GIANT. I wasn't exactly looking to make a communication closet next to my computer desk, but everything with this case is amazing, and the design is excellent. This makes working on anything inside easy, as you can have nearly every panel off to do as you please with it, and very little to hold you back.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: It's BIG
customer_reviews.text: It's big! But, I will never run out of room. Case is big enough for very large hands to work in without any issues. Wires management is easy because of all of this room. It's sturdy. Buttons/usb connectors are easily swapped to the other side. Comes with extra hardware like screws, thumbscrews for the panels and internals, tie wraps. All panels are easily removed via 2 thumbscrews in most cases. Very happy with this case.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great case but make sure you have the space for it
customer_reviews.text: Great case if you want great liquid or air cooling. I'm air cooling for now- 200mm fan on the front and 6 120mm fans on the top. Visually, it was larger that I anticipated (particularly in the of height) so make sure you check measurements and add a couple for inches for airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This case is what I needed to fit my super micro board. Only drawback is it is huge.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case
customer_reviews.text: This case is very high quality. Very well put together and thought out design wise. It is huge water cooling everything would be no problem. Cable management is also great. I have built a couple other top of the line gaming machines with a Corsair 750d and a Fractal Design define R5, The Thermaltake Core X9 is 10x the case!
customer_reviews.author: ccbiggs

customer_reviews.title: Massive capacity
customer_reviews.text: BEAST of a case. Has room for just about everything you'd ever need. I'll still be picking up a second to stack up and load with drives and radiators. The huge clear window is a perfect fit with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Dodge

customer_reviews.title: This case is amazing. I did not expect it to be so ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is amazing. I did not expect it to be so large but after opening it up and finding all the features, its absolutely fantastic. The thumb screws mostly come out without resistance however there were a few that took a screw driver. Other than that, everything inside the case is built solidly and I have no complaints about the case what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very suspicious
customer_reviews.text: Came packaged new but feels open boxed. I got the accessory bag but was confused when i found 3 random screws at the bottom but what really gave me suspicions is i only had 1 toolless bracket for the 5.25 bays when pictures/videos show 2. if you're gonna use the hard drive bay buy new brackets because the handles snap so easy. I'd rate it 4/5 overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Nunnery

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Monster
customer_reviews.text: Enormous case. Like collosal. Was initially going to buy a 900D,but couldn't be happier with my decision to get this one instead. Plenty of room to route cables and put as much stuff in there as your heart desires. If you don't want a case that you could stuff medium sized animals in, then you ought to look elsewhere. Also, one of the few horizontal mounted motherboard cases out there and I am personally a fan of that type of configuration. Easier to work with in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: this one is really huge
customer_reviews.text: It was for my son he likes it but did admit its too big. this one is really huge i prefer my corsair but that's me. there is alot of room but u can not put fans in from of the hard drive cage not enough clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah S.

customer_reviews.title: little bigger than I visualized but I love this case
customer_reviews.text: Been assembling computers since the 286 days. I love this case the way it's designed allows me to put everything right where I want it. Very easy to place everything in too. If you have the room I cannot recommend this case enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case if you need space
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case if you need space. It is definitely way more space than I would ever need, but made the assembly a very enjoyable process. Instructions are a little weak, but you don't really need them that much as the customization is very simple. Be warned, it is much bigger than you expect.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Not an exact fit for a Supermicro X10DRI motherboard. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not an exact fit for a Supermicro X10DRI motherboard. Most of the screw hole locations lined up. Used MB standoffs for the rest. Otherwise plenty of space for everything and tons of airflow.
customer_reviews.author: bel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it good I wish they come with tempered glass on top and 2 side
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.  Very large.
customer_reviews.text: Easily the biggest case I've ever owned and probably the nicest.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Best microwave computter case
customer_reviews.text: Fits everything nicely and is much easier to manage than the vertical set motherboard case I had previously. The only issue I had with is was the plastic window as it prevented that side from having effective fans on it but I remedied that issue but replacing it with metal mesh but this wasn't enough for me to consider it a 4 rather than 5 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Best case ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Thermaltake core x9 is awesome. The space inside with all the components is amazing. Will all the hidden drives and modular format. Everything about it makes it unreal. With so much expansion inside the case. Only thing to make it better would be to stack and remodel to a water cooled format.
customer_reviews.author: John F Moore

customer_reviews.title: Huge Awesome Case!!!
customer_reviews.text: Huge modular case. Plenty of space for water and air cooling. Easy to access and assemble. I knocked off one star just because (like many other reviews) it came with some minor damages (slightly bent panel corners, captive screws at angles, bent fan grills, etc....).
customer_reviews.author: TigerMAS

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to work on and the location of the front ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room for activities! Very easy to work on and the location of the front bays do not require extra long SATA or Power cables. The metal is a bit thin and I had to bend the doors a bit to get them back to square.
customer_reviews.author: Webic

customer_reviews.title: HUGE case.
customer_reviews.text: First off, this case is MASSIVE(think mini fridge). So, if you're short on space, you might want to look at something else. Overall, it's great to work with and has everything I'm looking for. I have a lot of large components so I wanted something with extra space. Ventilation shouldn't be an issue either as this has just about any options you can look for whether it be liquid or air as far as mounting goes. For its size and features, it's an awesome deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Case is awesome, however none of the usb 3
customer_reviews.text: Case is awesome, however none of the usb 3.0 ports work... I have tried on two morher boards. My old usb 3.0 ports plug in and work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T.

customer_reviews.title: I like the design
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, i bought this for future project its actually extremely spacious and weights a good bit. i have the mini itx versions and would consider this the bigdaddy with all the features worth considering in your build.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy At Iwakuni

customer_reviews.title: I love the case overall
customer_reviews.text: I love the case overall. The filters in the front and bottom of the case missed the theme of being magnetically attached or even slide in and clip.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: DA BOMB
customer_reviews.text: This case is super functional and very pretty! The case is very detail oriented. Dust filters galore! Dozens of fans and radiator options. Easy to work with hardware. I am extremely happy with this case. I have no complaints. If you are considering getting this case... do yourself a favor and get it. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits everything i need...The last case you will ever have to buy!
customer_reviews.author: RYAN B JEFFRIES

customer_reviews.title: Monsterous big!!! I love it though!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly love this Gynormrous big case! I can see where someone building micro system might not appreciate it, unless they wanted to use liquid cooling though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It all fits and the fit and finish on this case was awesome. I'm a novice but my brother has built ...
customer_reviews.text: I slammed a serious mining rig with this case. EVGA 1080ti x 5 with all the bells and whistles. It all fits and the fit and finish on this case was awesome. I'm a novice but my brother has built 8 rigs this year and strongly agreed. PIMP.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kasten

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Super nice case. Massive. Way bigger than I expected and that is a good thing. everything is very high quality and built sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Worth

customer_reviews.title: Best cube case ever
customer_reviews.text: I purchased thia case for an E-ATX server motherboard that looks great. I love the way how you can move all the brackets around for your needs. Is a big case but looks great as a server
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Awesome case! Huge with plenty of room for creativity. Cons: 1) Cable management. Although not really a con, but if you are sort of a "neat freak" that likes to hide cables away for a cleaner look then, it might get a little difficult, but not impossible. 2) Did I say huge? Be sure to have enough space for this beast. I added a pic. It may not be the cleanest build, but I Iike it. The case is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.AB

customer_reviews.title: Best case every
customer_reviews.text: Best case every, easy to to set up and cord control was easy and out of the way it wasn't cramped like other cases can be.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe P looking forward to the next one

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge Brought wheels 2 power supplies watercooled Sli 2 Quad radiators. Heavy..
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: This case by far is the best i have own
customer_reviews.text: This case by far is the best i have own. I tend to upgrade my cases every two yrs.
customer_reviews.author: A5

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great case for airflow or liquid cooling. Very large so make sure you check your dimensions before you buy it. Instructions could've been more helpful for fan placement and how to mount them in certain areas, but other than that the case is built very well and it's nice to have interchangeable side panels and power/usb bar. This case is comparable to entry Case Labs cases for a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Nice case.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with plenty of room to spare for my ITX setup.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Broken parts on arrival, more broken parts less than one day later
customer_reviews.text: All four feet were broken upon arrival. Both tabs on one 3.5" tray simultaneously broke when attempting to remove the tray, roughly 48 hours after receipt and unboxing. Due to flimsy materials and/or poor handling of package, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Donna G.

customer_reviews.title: I have two of these stacked with 6 Alphacool UT60's ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these stacked with 6 Alphacool UT60's 420 x 60 radiators in a push pull config with 6 Fractal Design Venturi fans on each radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer Man

customer_reviews.title: It's a great case with many configurable aspects
customer_reviews.text: It's huge... I got this because of the airflow potential and the horizontal mobo mount. It's a great case with many configurable aspects, and there's not many others like it. I do believe that some aspects could have been done a little better, but for the money this thing is gold!
customer_reviews.author: gigaphreak

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. A little heavy but I knew that going ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. A little heavy but I knew that going in. Keeping everything cool and all my disk drives fit.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Carter

customer_reviews.title: Case is bigger in size on arrival ( tl;dr Casezilla)
customer_reviews.text: A monster case, great space for liquid coolers, and supports ATX motherboards, as well as micro atx.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gleich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: amazing expandability, would be nice if I could somehow fit another mobo in this beast
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Spacious
customer_reviews.text: This case over plenty of room and is great for those big builds. Hope to have this baby in max condition soon. A must buy for builders who like room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE - I have a huge head and it fits inside comfortably with mobo installed!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this enormous and extremely versatile case. 11/10 I've told 5 friends so far to buy one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: teh bomb

customer_reviews.title: Like two towers laid flat
customer_reviews.text: This case is HUGE. Like two towers laid flat, stacked on top of each other. Plenty of room for any and all customization. Could easily mount two full machines and still have plenty of room for fans and cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F.

customer_reviews.title: Not as descripted.
customer_reviews.text: Product came dented with the door panel screws bent. Also states a 200mm fan in the front and it is not
customer_reviews.author: Cody Rowcliff

customer_reviews.title: This case is HUGE! I guess I should've looked ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is HUGE! I guess I should've looked at the dimensions. Plenty of room to work and manage cables.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Turner

customer_reviews.title: Bigger then expected
customer_reviews.text: Much larger then I expected. But the case is quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case
customer_reviews.text: It has lots of room to customize my computer. It worked for my Dell Precision T5500 case swap.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Featherston

customer_reviews.title: The best. I have so much room for my first ...
customer_reviews.text: The best. I have so much room for my first computer build that I was able to add all my dream parts with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: GARY

product_meta.title: Thermaltake Core X9 Black Edition E-ATX Stackable Tt LCS Certified Cube Computer Chassis CA-1D8-00F1WN-00
product_meta.description:
Style:Core X9 E-ATX Black"Core X9 Black E-ATX Stackable Tt LCS Certified Cube Chassis CA-1D8-00F1WN-00: 

Redefine your cooling expectations with the Thermaltake Core X9 Cube Chassis. With an Enthusiast level of expandability, for both Air and Liquid cooling configurations, the Core X9 is in a class above the rest. Expand the limits with a stackable design allowing externally-modular upgrades to provide extended storage, cooling, and ideal cable management. With unparalleled cooling performance, the Core X9 accommodates DIY/AIO liquid cooling components with ease while offering various ventilation only Thermaltake can deliver.


Key Features: 
 * Case Type: E-ATX Cube Chassis
 * Case Dimension (H x W x D): 19.8" x 15" x 25.2"
 * M/B Type: Extend ATX (12.0"" x 13.0""), ATX (12.0"" x 9.6""), MicroATX (9.6"" x 9.6""), Mini-ITX (6.7"" x 6.7"")
 * Side Panels: Window/Perforated
 * Supports : Standard PS2 Power Supply
 *  External Bay:3 x 5.25"
 * Internal Bay: 6 x 3.5"" or 2.5"" (HDD Cage), 1 x 3.5"", 2 x 2.5"" (M/B Tray)
 * Expansion Slots: 8
 * Front I/O Panel: 4 x USB 3.0, 1x Headphone, 1x Mic Ports


Fans Included: 
 * Front (Intake Fan): (1) 200 x 200 x 30 mm 
 * Rear (exhaust) : (1) 120 x 120 x 25 mm


Clearence: 
 * CPU Cooler Height: 250mm 
 * VGA Length: 
   400mm (w/ ODD Cage) 
   590mm (w/o ODD Cage) 
 * PSU Length: 220mm (w/ Bottom Fan)


Fan Configurations: (Optional) 
Front: 
3 x 120mm or 2 x 140mm or 2 x 200mm
Top: 
8 x 120mm or 6 x 140mm or 2 x 200mm
Rear: 
2 x 120mm or 2 x 140mm
Bottom: 
3 x 120mm
Left / Right Side: 
4 x 120mm or 3 x 140mm


Radiator Configurations: (Optional)
Front: 
1 x 120mm or 1 x 240mm or 1 x 360mm 
1 x 140mm or 1 x 280mm
Top: 
2 x 120mm or 2 x 240mm or 2 x 360mm or 2 x 480mm
2 x 140mm or 2 x 280mm or 2 x 420mm
Rear: 
1 x 120mm or or 1 x 140mm
Left / Right Side: 
1 x 120mm or 1 x 240mm or 1 x 360mm or 1 x 480mm
1 x 140mm or 1 x 280mm or 1 x 420mm
Bottom: 
1 x 120mm or 1 x 240mm or 1 x 360mm or 1 x 480mm
1 x 140mm or 1 x 280mm or 1 x 420mm



Support: 
 Please visit our website or search “Thermaltake Support” for any assistance.

"
feature_bullets: Tt LCS Certified: Thermaltake exclusive certification applied to only products that pass the design and hardcore enthusiasts standards
Supports 4x USB 3.0 ports with HD Audio ports for convenient front panel access. Cooling System : Front (intake):(800rpm,13dBA), Rear (exhaust):(1000rpm,16dBA)
Fully Modular Design: Provides multiple configurations and flexibility for custom PC Enthusiasts
Interchangeable Window and I/O Panel: Customize for the best viewing presentation with an interchangeable window and I/O panel design
Chamber Concept: Optimized for space management, the Core X9 is divided into two main chambers for cooling performance and improved efficiency
